Posts.Content: jsims2 wrote: I was wondering if anyone has questioned their oncologist and asked for something different than what your oncologist has recommended?  I am willing to do most of the radiation that he wants to do, but I do not want any radiation on the site of where my breast was and let him radiate the breast bone and the lymph node area where one was possitive.  Do you think this is an unreasonable request?  The reason for this is because I do not want to go through the TRAM flap reconstruction I would rather have expanders and implants.  I have a 5 year old and a 2 year old and 6 week recovery is not an option. Janet Dx 4/23/2007, IDC, 2cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 1/21 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Has anyone tweeked their treatment? jsims2 nevaeh

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2007 03:25PM - edited Oct 3, 2007 03:25PM by jsims2 I have  been through 6 rounds of TAC and now they want me to do Radiation and I have had bilateral mastectomies on 5/1/07.  I am fighting the radiation with everything I have..  I was also told that I would not need to ever have another mamogram.  Had my first at 39 and I will never need another one after reconstruction.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy then Rad - I am sooo confused Held jsims2

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2007 02:27PM - edited Oct 3, 2007 02:27PM by jsims2 I had my bilateral on 5/1/07 and started chemo on 6/1/07.  I just wanted to get the party started as they say.  They just want to make sure you are healed before you start the process.
